intro: Trachyandra scabra, commonly known as the rough trachyandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the yellow rain lilies. The plant is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Trachyandra scabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
